subject: Business
title: Measuring Product-Market Fit
description: A quick win: understand Measuring Product-Market Fit.

hook.text: Your users are growing, but does that mean you have product-market fit? Not necessarily.

buildup.text: Sean Ellis proposed a benchmark: survey users and ask how they'd feel without your product.

discovery.text: If 40% or more say 'very disappointed,' you likely have fit. Below that, keep iterating.

twist.text: Growth can mask a lack of fit. Paid ads drive signups, but retention tells the real story.

climax.text: Track cohort retention over 8 weeks. If the curve flattens above zero, your product has staying power.

punchline.text: Growth without retention is a leaking bucket.

quiz.question: Which metric best indicates true product-market fit?
